bestBHT.bht: The day of the Lord shall come as a thief, suddenly and unexpectedly. The heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the works of nature and art will be dissolved and burned up. This day will bring about a complete transformation of the earth and purify it from everything that is harmful and unpleasant. As believers, we must be watchful and ready for this inevitable day, knowing that it will come upon us without warning.

Henry Alford: But (notwithstanding the delay) the day of the Lord shall (or, will) come as a thief in which the heavens shall pass away with a rushing noise, and the heavenly bodies being scorched up shall be dissolved, and the earth and the works in it shall be burned up.
It is more than merely 'shall come,' though no one word will give the exact force in English: 'shall be here,' 'shall be upon you'.
This may mean either the works of men, buildings and the like,—or, the works of the Creator: perhaps both of these combined, 'the works of nature and art'.
Jamieson-Fausset-Brown: The day of the Lord SHALL come and be present."
The heavens... with a great noise... the works therein... melt.
Albert Barnes: The day of the Lord Jesus. That is, the day in which he will be manifested.
Will come as a thief in the night - Unexpectedly; suddenly.

The idea is, that the cause of their being 'dissolved' shall be fire; or that there will be a conflagration extending to what are here called the 'elements,' that shall produce the effects here described by the word 'dissolved'.
Marvin Vincent: The day of the Lord. Compare the same phrase in Peter's sermon, Acts 2:20. It occurs only in these two passages and 1 Thessalonians 5:2."
As a thief. Omit in the night. Compare Matthew 24:43; 1 Thessalonians 4:2, 1 Thessalonians 4:4; Revelation 3:3; Revelation 16:15.
With a great noise [ροιζηδον] . An adverb peculiar to Peter, and occurring only here.
John Calvin: But the day of the Lord will come...that the faithful might be always watching, and not promise to-morrow to themselves.
For we all labor under two very different evils — too much haste, and slothfulness.
For he thus reasons, that as heaven and earth are to be purged by fire, that they may correspond with the kingdom of Christ, hence the renovation of men is much more necessary.
Philip Schaff: Though some deem it so late of appearing (the writer means), that it may never appear, and though it is true that God in His long-suffering delays the event, ‘yet come will (or, ‘on you shall be ‘) the day of the Lord.’
The suddenness with which it will enter is next asserted. as a thief: the best authorities omit the words ‘in the night’ which are added in the A. V.
The phrase ‘with a great noise,’ which is given by both the A. V. and the R. V., is a prosaic rendering, which entirely fails to do justice to the singular vividness and force of the original.
Archibald T. Robertson: This great day will certainly come (ηξε).
As a thief (ως κλεπτης). That is suddenly, without notice.
With a great noise (ροιζηδον). Late and rare adverb... onomatopoetic, whizzing sound of rapid motion through the air like the flight of a bird, thunder, fierce flame.
John Gill: he will come as a thief, in the dark, indiscernibly; it will not be known what hour he will come; he will come suddenly, at an unawares, to the great surprise of men"
the heavens shall pass away with a great noise, like that of a violent storm, or tempest"
the elements shall melt with fervent heat...the earth also will be purged and purified from everything that is noxious, hurtful, unnecessary, and disagreeable
John Wesley: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief — Suddenly, unexpectedly.
In which the heavens shall pass away with a great noise — Surprisingly expressed by the very sound of the original word.

The elements shall melt with fervent heat — The elements seem to mean, the sun, moon, and stars; not the four, commonly so called; for air and water cannot melt, and the earth is mentioned immediately after.

bhtAttempts.bht: The day of the Lord will come unexpectedly, like a thief in the night. The heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the elements will melt with fervent heat. Everything in the earth, whether the works of men or the works of the Creator, shall be burned up. This day will come suddenly and unawares, surprising everyone. The day of the Lord is not to be taken lightly, for it will bring about a complete transformation of the heavens and the earth. Men must be watchful and ready for this inevitable day, as it will come upon them without warning.

The day of the Lord shall (or, will) come as a thief, unexpectedly and suddenly. The heavens shall pass away with a great noise, the heavenly bodies scorched up and dissolved, and the earth and the works in it shall be burned up. This day will bring about a complete transformation of the world, purging and purifying it with fervent heat. As believers, we must be watchful and ready, knowing that the day of the Lord is certain to come upon us.

The day of the Lord shall come as a thief, suddenly and without notice. The heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the works of creation and the works of men will be dissolved and burned up. This day will bring about a complete transformation of the earth, purging and purifying it with fervent heat. As believers, we must be vigilant and prepared, knowing that the day of the Lord is certain and will happen unexpectedly.

The day of the Lord shall come as a thief, suddenly and unexpectedly. The heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the works of nature and art will be dissolved and burned up. This day will bring about a complete transformation of the earth and purify it from everything that is harmful and unpleasant. As believers, we must be watchful and ready for this inevitable day, knowing that it will come upon us without warning.

The day of the Lord shall come as a thief, unexpectedly and suddenly. The heavens will pass away with a great noise, and the elements will melt with fervent heat, purging and purifying the earth. This day will bring about a complete transformation, burning up the works of men and the works of the Creator. As believers, we must be watchful and prepared for this inevitable day, for it will come upon us without warning.
